what: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007)
title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007)
text: karlen provides real-time PCR data sets Karlen et al. (2007) tidy format.

title: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007)
Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007)
text: raw PCR amplification curve data Karlen et al. (2007) provided one single eponymously named data set: karlen. original publication data set pertaining one PCR plate provided separate spreadsheet file. column plate karlen distinguishes data set. karlen data set comprises quantitative real-time PCRs four samples (S1 thru S4), seven amplicons targeting seven genes: Cav1, Ctfg, Eln, Fn1, Rpl27, Hspg2, Serpine1. sample/target combination dilution series performed. One PCR plate used per amplicon, except Rpl27 (L27) assayed twice (plates L27_1 L27_2). target column indicates mouse gene symbol matching targeted amplicon. Two dilution series schemes assayed: Scheme 1 (Cav1, Eln, Hspg2, Serpine1): 1-fold, 10-fold, 50-fold, 100-fold; Scheme 2 (Ctgf, Rpl27, Fn1): 1-fold, 10-fold, 50-fold, 100-fold 1000-fold (two replicates ). Visualization amplification curves (NTC curves omitted):
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(karlen)  karlen |>   dplyr::distinct(plate, target, sample, sample_type) |>   print(n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 36 × 4 #>    plate target   sample sample_type #>    <fct> <fct>    <fct>  <fct>       #>  1 CAV   Cav1     S1     std         #>  2 CAV   Cav1     S2     std         #>  3 CAV   Cav1     S3     std         #>  4 CAV   Cav1     S4     std         #>  5 CAV   Cav1     <NA>   ntc         #>  6 CTGF  Ctgf     S1     std         #>  7 CTGF  Ctgf     S2     std         #>  8 CTGF  Ctgf     S3     std         #>  9 CTGF  Ctgf     S4     std         #> 10 ELN   Eln      S1     std         #> 11 ELN   Eln      S2     std         #> 12 ELN   Eln      S3     std         #> 13 ELN   Eln      S4     std         #> 14 ELN   Eln      <NA>   ntc         #> 15 L27_1 Rpl27    S1     std         #> 16 L27_1 Rpl27    S2     std         #> 17 L27_1 Rpl27    S3     std         #> 18 L27_1 Rpl27    S4     std         #> 19 L27_2 Rpl27    S1     std         #> 20 L27_2 Rpl27    S2     std         #> 21 L27_2 Rpl27    S3     std         #> 22 L27_2 Rpl27    S4     std         #> 23 FN    Fn1      S1     std         #> 24 FN    Fn1      S2     std         #> 25 FN    Fn1      S3     std         #> 26 FN    Fn1      S4     std         #> 27 Perl  Hspg2    S1     std         #> 28 Perl  Hspg2    S2     std         #> 29 Perl  Hspg2    S3     std         #> 30 Perl  Hspg2    S4     std         #> 31 Perl  Hspg2    <NA>   ntc         #> 32 PAI1  Serpine1 S1     std         #> 33 PAI1  Serpine1 S2     std         #> 34 PAI1  Serpine1 S3     std         #> 35 PAI1  Serpine1 S4     std         #> 36 PAI1  Serpine1 <NA>   ntc karlen |>   dplyr::filter(sample_type == "std") |>   dplyr::distinct(plate, target, dilution) |>   print(n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 36 × 3 #>    plate target   dilution #>    <fct> <fct>       <int> #>  1 CAV   Cav1            1 #>  2 CAV   Cav1           10 #>  3 CAV   Cav1           50 #>  4 CAV   Cav1          100 #>  5 CTGF  Ctgf            1 #>  6 CTGF  Ctgf           10 #>  7 CTGF  Ctgf           50 #>  8 CTGF  Ctgf          100 #>  9 CTGF  Ctgf         1000 #> 10 ELN   Eln             1 #> 11 ELN   Eln            10 #> 12 ELN   Eln            50 #> 13 ELN   Eln           100 #> 14 L27_1 Rpl27           1 #> 15 L27_1 Rpl27          10 #> 16 L27_1 Rpl27          50 #> 17 L27_1 Rpl27         100 #> 18 L27_1 Rpl27        1000 #> 19 L27_2 Rpl27           1 #> 20 L27_2 Rpl27          10 #> 21 L27_2 Rpl27          50 #> 22 L27_2 Rpl27         100 #> 23 L27_2 Rpl27        1000 #> 24 FN    Fn1             1 #> 25 FN    Fn1            10 #> 26 FN    Fn1            50 #> 27 FN    Fn1           100 #> 28 FN    Fn1          1000 #> 29 Perl  Hspg2           1 #> 30 Perl  Hspg2          10 #> 31 Perl  Hspg2          50 #> 32 Perl  Hspg2         100 #> 33 PAI1  Serpine1        1 #> 34 PAI1  Serpine1       10 #> 35 PAI1  Serpine1       50 #> 36 PAI1  Serpine1      100 karlen |>   dplyr::filter(sample_type != "ntc") |>   ggplot(aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = well, col = as.factor(dilution))) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.1) +   geom_point(size = 0.05) +   facet_grid(rows = vars(plate), cols = vars(sample), scales = "free_y") +   labs(color = "Fold dilution")

what: karlen: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007) — karlen-package
title: karlen: Real-Time PCR Data Sets by Karlen et al. (2007) — karlen-package
text: Real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) data sets Karlen et al. (2007) doi:10.1186/1471-2105-8-131 . package provides one single tabular tidy data set long format, encompassing 32 dilution series, seven PCR targets four biological samples. targeted amplicons within murine genes: Cav1, Ctfg, Eln, Fn1, Rpl27, Hspg2, Serpine1, respectively. Dilution series: scheme 1 (Cav1, Eln, Hspg2, Serpine1): 1-fold, 10-fold, 50-fold, 100-fold; scheme 2 (Ctgf, Rpl27, Fn1): 1-fold, 10-fold, 50-fold, 100-fold 1000-fold. concentration five replicates, except 1000-fold concentration, two replicates performed. amplification curve 40 cycles long. Original raw data file Additional file 2 publication: https://static-content.springer.com/esm/art%3A10.1186%2F1471-2105-8-131/MediaObjects/12859_2006_1503_MOESM2_ESM.ZIP.
